Famous Vermonters

Itâ€™s been about four years since Iâ€™ve written here, and a lot has changed. My wife and I were married in July 2019, and we welcomed our daughter in April 2021. What a whirlwind! We like to keep the focus on mapping and Vermont here at this site, but I do feel very lucky and proud of our little family â¤ï¸

Weâ€™ve also just moved back to the state (July 2021) and Iâ€™ve got a million blog post ideas. Iâ€™ll start with a straightforward one- whoâ€™s the most famous Vermonter ever? Ethan Allen? Bernie Sanders? Calvin Coolidge? John Deere? John LeClair?

And how do you define famous? And the classic question- how do you decide who is a Vermonter? Iâ€™m going to rely on wikipedia to enforce both of these standards. Itâ€™s a little dubious, but we need some help:

  • â€˜Famousâ€™ will be defined using qrank, a ranking system using wikipedia pageviews
  • â€˜Vermonterâ€™ as defined by the List of people from Vermont wikipedia article

Pulling the data

I used the incredible npm wtf_wikipedia package to pull down the Famous Vermonters data. The package made it really easy to pull in this data- letting me poke at it in a node REPL until I had it working correctly. To match each famous vermonter to their respective qrank, I then queried the wikipedia API to get their wikidata ID, then wrote the output to a CSV. As a node n00b it probably took me three full hours to get the async stuff right. I tried it all- requests, promises, request-promises, you name it.

Hereâ€™s the code to build a CSV of Famous Vermonter and their wikidata IDs in case you want to follow along at home.

Importing it into SQL

And to import the Famous Vermonters CSV into postgres:

create table vermonters (qid text, name text);
\COPY vermonters(qid, name) from 'famous_vermonters.csv' DELIMITER ',' CSV HEADER;

I did some similar with the qrank dataset, but have misplaced that code. Itâ€™s a pretty straightforward CSV â€“> postgres import.

Database queries

OK, now weâ€™ve got our famous vermonters CSV and the ranking for all wikidata entries . . . letâ€™s join them ğŸ‰

select distinct on (qrank, qid) name, qrank
from vermonters a,
  qrank b
where a.qid = b.entity
order by qrank desc, qid;

And the winner is . . . ğŸ¥ğŸ¥ğŸ¥

Now bear in mind that this is purely a ranking of how many times folks have clicked on this personâ€™s wikipedia page. And this person didnâ€™t even really grow up in Vermont. And . . . ok here are the final rankings:

Whatâ€™s next?

Wow - by wikipedia standards Ted Bundy is more than twice as famous as Bernie Sanders . . . eesh. Iâ€™m not sure how we can change this, other than visiting the wikipedia articles of our favorite lesser-known Vermonters to bump them up the list.
